role.descr: second item in comparison, usually prepositional

roles.note: watch out for instances where contrast appears in a PP with no preposition-- don't annotate these.

example.name: arg 1 should be a trace in these instances; otherwise, .ER
example.text: [Its loss of $77.7 million, or $1.86 a share]-1, contrasted *trace*-1 with net of $68.5 million, or $1.58a share, in the 1988 third quarter.
example.arg: *trace*-1: [Its loss of $77.7 million, or $1.86 a share]
with net of $68.5 million, or $1.58 a share, in the 1988 third quarter

example.name: arg1 as subject
example.text: This contrasts with the year-ago quarter, when the company had net income of $11.7 million, or 45 cents a share, on revenue of $75.7 million.
example.arg: with the year-ago quarter, when the company had net income of $11.7 million, or 45 cents a share, on revenue of $75.7 million

example.name: all args
example.text: John contrasted his ideas with the professor's argument.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'contrast' based on sentences in financial subcorpus and automatic expansion via verbnet.
